TopicTitle: How many hours have you put into KSP?

Articles.Content:
I just hit the 400 hours mark in KSP, and still exploring!

I was wondering ho many hours others have put into the game. Also, whats your currant "Stardate" / Games start on Year 1, Day - 0h

My longest Stardate so far is Year 52, Day 124 - 1h So if I compared this to the start of the Mercury program... It would be 2011 in KSP for me right now.

Edited May 15, 2014 by Chrono

Still loving every minute.

I may be taking a break for a while though.. This has become the norm lately.

Edited May 15, 2014 by Jas1126
I don't have it on Steam. I like not knowing.
I only started 2 days ago. Still getting into it but so far I've clocked about 10 hours.
Just under 300 hours on Steam... and an undetermined number of hours in non-Steam instances

I don't have it on Steam. I like not knowing.

Same here.

But given how long I've had the game, even taking the breaks into account, I'm probably close to the 1000h mark.

I bought it of Steam, but play a copy in another folder, so I cannot say for sure.

I joined the club in June 2013, play it about 3-5 days a week for about 4-6 hours - plus excesses and some holiday sessions - so maybe ... 576-1440 hours statistically, but that sounds quite much.
I think "hours" isn't quite a useable measure anymore xD

Got the demo in feb/march 2012, paid for the game in may 2012, and still going strong

Boris

Think I've played long enough to do a Duna mission in real time
No clue, but it's easily in the hundreds.
Got the game a few days ago, 12 hours until now, and were in the hockey finale...
I believe I'm around the 170's range. I'd have a lot more, but I'm easily distracted by other games as well.

Steam says I'm at 620 hours, but I've heard that Steam lies, inflating that number, but I still learn something new every day. Possibly my favorite game ever, and I had a brand new Pong when they first came out. :^\
Steam says 1667.
I try not to think about it and I'm glad I don't have it on steam so it can't be quantified. I've had KSP since 2012 and I think my time spent in game is best measured in months.
Probably over 2000 hours.. haven't been counting..

I joined the club in June 2013, play it about 3-5 days a week for about 4-6 hours - plus excesses and some holiday sessions - so maybe ... 576-1440 hours statistically, but that sounds quite much.

There works the mind of a true engineer.
Just recently passed 150, don't think I've yet gotten to 160. So, not long. I've had the game since... December, I think. Around the end of last year, anyway.
Though I don't have it on steam, my personal guess would be something around 1000-1500 hours, considering i started playing in .12 and have been playing almost all of my free time since.

I think "hours" isn't quite a useable measure anymore xD

Yes, I think it is as inadequate as measuring astronomical distances in kilometers or miles....

Around 350 hours here... Just a moment, did i say hours...?
Been here since 0.8 so I guess way more than 2000 hours and still playing everyday.
I was at 400 Hours at the beginning of the month, but than I moved to a seperate Installation to get it with all the different mods running, and Steam is no longer watching me, so ist now about 500.

Been here since 0.8 so I guess way more than 2000 hours and still playing everyday.

Behold the presence of one of the Old Ones!

I think .8 might be the first time I came across KSP on Steam or somewhere else - and put it aside as "unfinished, for later" ... so glad we crossed paths again.

150 hours on Steam, but I played a lot before that, so around 400. Had the game before I created this account.

- - - Updated - - -

Behold the presence of one of the Old Ones!

I think .8 might be the first time I came across KSP on Steam or somewhere else - and put it aside as "unfinished, for later" ... so glad we crossed paths again.

KSP was added on steam on around .18? So thats not possible.

150 hours on Steam, but I played a lot before that, so around 400. Had the game before I created this account.

KSP was added on steam on around .18? So thats not possible.

Well he did say "or something else"
